Microgrids.Description: Microgrids often rely on renewable energy sources such as solar or wind power to generate electricity.
Microgrids can incorporate energy storage systems to store excess energy generated during low demand periods for use during high demand periods.
Microgrids can be connected to smart grids to enable efficient energy management and grid stability.
Microgrids often include distributed energy resources such as small-scale generators or renewable energy systems.
